title: Ilsensine
data:
| ***[Religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion") in NetHack***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - [priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest")
- [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment")
- [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record")
- [altars](/wiki/Altar "Altar")
- [atheism](/wiki/Atheist "Atheist")
- [anger](/wiki/Anger "Anger")
- [gods](/wiki/God "God")

**Ilsensine** is a being associated with the [mind flayers](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack").

## dNetHack

**Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Anachrononaut and Android roles.** They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

[x][ ]

- Anachrononaut quest
- Role spoiler

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, Ilsensine plays a major role in the background of the [Anachrononaut](/wiki/Anachrononaut "Anachrononaut") and [their quest](/wiki/Anachrononaut_quest "Anachrononaut quest"), as well as the [Android](/wiki/Android "Android") and [their quest](/index.php?title=Android_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Android quest (page does not exist)").

In the "age before ages", the [mind flayers](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") discovered and worshipped an eldritch "nascent thought" who came to be known as Ilsensine - in bringing knowledge of Ilsensine back to the past, they set off a chain of events that caused the end of the world: the mind flayer empires were overthrown and brought low, but the [gods](/wiki/God "God") of Law discovered Ilsensine and were consumed, followed by the other gods of the heavens. As a result, Anachrononauts and Androids do not worship gods and cannot [pray](/wiki/Pray "Pray") or make use of [altars](/wiki/Altar "Altar"), and attempting to pray will print a message stating that Ilsensine is the sole god of the future and is not prayed to; their starting pantheon is also selected at random, similar to the [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest").

In order to change the future and gain a full-scoring [ascension](/wiki/Ascension "Ascension"), an Anachrononaut or Android must gain access to their [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") from the quest leader Sara before she is killed, then retrieve [the Annulus](/wiki/The_Annulus "The Annulus") and obtain the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), bring both items to the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") and [invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") the Annulus on the lawful high altar to purge Ilsensine's influence once and for all - once done, the Anachrononaut can then offer the Amulet on their god's high altar to attain a full-scoring ascension with the future saved.

An Anachrononaut that accepts their quest becomes aware of Ilsensine's identity as **the Banished One** and their guise as the lawful god of their pantheon, and Ilsensine will in turn become aware of them - conversely, the Android begins the game already aware of Ilsensine (and vice versa). While in the guise of a lawful deity, Ilsensine will summon the same minions as the real deity would; once the Anachrononaut becomes aware of Ilsensine, it acts as an unholy deity, and its [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion") consist of mind flayers, [master mind flayers](/wiki/Master_mind_flayer "Master mind flayer"), [brain golems](/index.php?title=Brain_golem\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Brain golem (page does not exist)"), and [semblances](/index.php?title=Semblance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Semblance (page does not exist)").

[Shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") on the Anachrononaut quest will call upon Ilsensine instead of the [Keter Sephiroth](/wiki/Keter_Sephiroth "Keter Sephiroth") if they are robbed or angered: this will generate two [changed](/wiki/Changed "Changed"), a [warrior changed](/wiki/Warrior_changed "Warrior changed"), a mind flayer, a master mind flayer, and an [umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk "Umber hulk") on adjacent squares to the shopkeeper, followed by that shopkeeper dying (which is flavored as Ilsensine killing them).

## notdNetHack

**Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role.** They can be accessed by selecting the "spoiler" tabs.

[x][ ][ ]

- Illithanachronounbinder quest
- Role spoiler
- Ilsensine spoiler

In addition to dNetHack details above, Ilsensine plays a similar major role in the background of the [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder") and [their quest](/index.php?title=Illithanachronounbinder_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Illithanachronounbinder quest (page does not exist)") in notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack.

The Illithanachronounbinder comes from a future in which Ilsensine (who is referred to as "she" and "her") was successfully thwarted and erased, with the goal of undoing what the Anachrononauts achieved in order to save their goddess and restore the Illithid Empire. Ilsensine is the [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") deity for the Illithanachronounbinder pantheon in notdNetHack, and has the same basic qualities and selection of minions for Illithanachronounbinders as she does for Anachrononauts: she cannot be prayed to by an Illithanachronounbinder, and doing so in the Illithanachronounbinder quest also prints a message related to their goal in restoring her. ("You wouldn't want to change the future.")

In order to change the future and gain a full-scoring ascension, an Illithanachronounbinder must invoke [The Illithid Staff](/wiki/The_Illithid_Staff "The Illithid Staff") with [The Elder Cerebral Fluid](/wiki/The_Elder_Cerebral_Fluid "The Elder Cerebral Fluid") affixed to it while standing atop the high altar to [the Void](/index.php?title=The_Void_\(deity\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Void (deity) (page does not exist)") on the Astral Plane, which takes the place of the usual lawful high altar. This grants them access to the Void as a branch, where they encounter all the [spirits](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") they previously bound and killed, with [Numina](/wiki/Numina "Numina") serving as the final boss: the Illithanachronounbinder must defeat whatever spirits stand in their way and reach Ilsensine within the depths of the Void, then offer the Amulet on her altar there - this restores Ilsensine to her former glory and earns the character the title of Maanzecorian, and they will ascend having saved the Illithid Empire.

| **[Genocidable](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | No                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                |

| **[Nutritional value](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | 500                                                                                                                                            |

| **[Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire"), [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep"), [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison"), [petrification](/wiki/Petrification "Petrification") |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                |
| Ilsensine The Fallen:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is female.
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                                                |

**Ilsensine The Fallen**, 7, appears as a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that Illithanachronounbinders can encounter. She is a [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") [lawful angelic being](/wiki/Lawful_angels_and_minions "Lawful angels and minions") that is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), will seek out and pick up items, can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), and is considered [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").

Ilsensine the Fallen has a powerful [passive](/wiki/Passive "Passive") [magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") attack similar to [the Oracle](/wiki/Oracle_\(monster\) "Oracle (monster)"), and possesses [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance").

Ilsensine is always generated as peaceful, and will only appear on the final level of [the Void](/index.php?title=The_Void_\(branch\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Void (branch) (page does not exist)"), where she is placed to the immediate left of her altar at level creation. She is not a valid form for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Of note is that there are currently no consequences for killing her outside of the usual penalties.

## Origin

Ilsensine originates from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, and debuts in the 2nd Edition as the the patron deity and creator of the illithids - this Ilsensine is referred to as "it" or "he", and his name means "great brain" or "powerful brain" in Undercommon. Also known as the Tentacled Lord and the God-Brain (not to be confused with a particular [elder brain](/wiki/Elder_brain "Elder brain")), Ilsensine embodied the illithids' ideals of mental prowess, unlimited knowledge and willful dominion over all other lifeforms; he was also the patron of all beings that enslaved the thoughts of others. Ilsensine's incarnation is a cohesive thought that takes the shape of a gigantic, pulsing mass of cerebral matter with a countless number of ganglionic tendrils radiating out in all directions; when incarnating in an avatar, his floating form is that of a spectral 8-foot (2.4 meter) glowing-green brain with only two tentacles.

Alien and elusive, elven myths attest that Ilsensine surpassed its divine peers in subversive intent, always striving to undo what others accomplish and defy established convention; to this end, it allegedly set loose the mind flayers as a counter-creation after mortals came into existence. The name Ilsensine is only used by the sages and scholars of most races: illithids identify it using a series of telepathic visual images and symbolic denotations, and Ilsensine itself lacks a physical body.

Ilsensine only believes in power, which to him is represented by raw psionic force, superior knowledge, and the mental capacity and force of mind required to both wield it and dominate others: this naturally makes his illithid creations the supreme race in its eyes, most worthy to conquer all planes and eventually all of reality while using all other life forms as "cattle". Ilsensine's psionics are such that any non-mindless being approaching its true form can sense his energy, creating a "brain burn" that afflicted those entering its realm, and within his proximity psionic powers are nulled and no secrets can stay hidden from him. Despite his strengths, omnipresence and practically limitless (though distinctly *not* omniscient) knowledge, Ilsensine is not infallible: he is supremely arrogant and vulnerable to emotion, to the point that he can be overtaken by it and driven towards problematic behavior.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Ilsensine

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Religion in NetHack
  • priests
  • alignment
  • alignment record
  • altars
  • atheism
  • anger
  • gods
  • sacrifice
  • prayer

Ilsensine is a being associated with the mind flayers that appears in dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack.

dNetHack

Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Anachrononaut and Android roles. They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, Ilsensine plays a major role in the background of the Anachrononaut and their quest, as well as the Android and their quest.

In the "age before ages", the mind flayers discovered and worshipped an eldritch "nascent thought" who came to be known as Ilsensine - in bringing knowledge of Ilsensine back to the past, they set off a chain of events that caused the end of the world: the mind flayer empires were overthrown and brought low, but the gods of Law discovered Ilsensine and were consumed, followed by the other gods of the heavens. As a result, Anachrononauts and Androids do not worship gods and cannot pray or make use of altars, and attempting to pray will print a message stating that Ilsensine is the sole god of the future and is not prayed to; their starting pantheon is also selected at random, similar to the Priest.

In order to change the future and gain a full-scoring ascension, an Anachrononaut or Android must gain access to their Quest from the quest leader Sara before she is killed, then retrieve the Annulus and obtain the Amulet of Yendor, bring both items to the Astral Plane and invoke the Annulus on the lawful high altar to purge Ilsensine's influence once and for all - once done, the Anachrononaut can then offer the Amulet on their god's high altar to attain a full-scoring ascension with the future saved.

An Anachrononaut that accepts their quest becomes aware of Ilsensine's identity as the Banished One and their guise as the lawful god of their pantheon, and Ilsensine will in turn become aware of them - conversely, the Android begins the game already aware of Ilsensine (and vice versa). While in the guise of a lawful deity, Ilsensine will summon the same minions as the real deity would; once the Anachrononaut becomes aware of Ilsensine, it acts as an unholy deity, and its minions consist of mind flayers, master mind flayers, brain golems, and semblances.

Shopkeepers on the Anachrononaut quest will call upon Ilsensine instead of the Keter Sephiroth if they are robbed or angered: this will generate two changed, a warrior changed, a mind flayer, a master mind flayer, and an umber hulk on adjacent squares to the shopkeeper, followed by that shopkeeper dying (which is flavored as Ilsensine killing them).

notdNetHack

Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role. They can be accessed by selecting the "spoiler" tabs.

In addition to dNetHack details above, Ilsensine plays a similar major role in the background of the Illithanachronounbinder and their quest in notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack.

The Illithanachronounbinder comes from a future in which Ilsensine (who is referred to as "she" and "her") was successfully thwarted and erased, with the goal of undoing what the Anachrononauts achieved in order to save their goddess and restore the Illithid Empire. Ilsensine is the lawful deity for the Illithanachronounbinder pantheon in notdNetHack, and has the same basic qualities and selection of minions for Illithanachronounbinders as she does for Anachrononauts: she cannot be prayed to by an Illithanachronounbinder, and doing so in the Illithanachronounbinder quest also prints a message related to their goal in restoring her. ("You wouldn't want to change the future.")

In order to change the future and gain a full-scoring ascension, an Illithanachronounbinder must invoke The Illithid Staff with The Elder Cerebral Fluid affixed to it while standing atop the high altar to the Void on the Astral Plane, which takes the place of the usual lawful high altar. This grants them access to the Void as a branch, where they encounter all the spirits they previously bound and killed, with Numina serving as the final boss: the Illithanachronounbinder must defeat whatever spirits stand in their way and reach Ilsensine within the depths of the Void, then offer the Amulet on her altar there - this restores Ilsensine to her former glory and earns the character the title of Maanzecorian, and they will ascend having saved the Illithid Empire.
7 Ilsensine The Fallen (No tile)
Difficulty 51
Attacks passive 10d10 magic missiles
7 Ilsensine The Fallen (No tile)
Difficulty 51
Attacks

passive 10d10 magic missiles

Base level 105
Base experience 12369
Speed 15
Base AC -8
Base MR 100
Alignment 12 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 2550
Nutritional value 500
Size huge
Resistances fire, sleep, poison, petrification

Ilsensine The Fallen:

  • can fly.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.

Ilsensine The Fallen, 7, appears as a monster that Illithanachronounbinders can encounter. She is a humanoid lawful angelic being that is strong, will seek out and pick up items, can be seen via infravision, and is considered human.

Ilsensine the Fallen has a powerful passive magic missile attack similar to the Oracle, and possesses fire resistance, sleep resistance, poison resistance, and stoning resistance.

Ilsensine is always generated as peaceful, and will only appear on the final level of the Void, where she is placed to the immediate left of her altar at level creation. She is not a valid form for polymorph.

Of note is that there are currently no consequences for killing her outside of the usual penalties.

Origin

Ilsensine originates from Dungeons & Dragons, and debuts in the 2nd Edition as the the patron deity and creator of the illithids - this Ilsensine is referred to as "it" or "he", and his name means "great brain" or "powerful brain" in Undercommon. Also known as the Tentacled Lord and the God-Brain (not to be confused with a particular elder brain), Ilsensine embodied the illithids' ideals of mental prowess, unlimited knowledge and willful dominion over all other lifeforms; he was also the patron of all beings that enslaved the thoughts of others. Ilsensine's incarnation is a cohesive thought that takes the shape of a gigantic, pulsing mass of cerebral matter with a countless number of ganglionic tendrils radiating out in all directions; when incarnating in an avatar, his floating form is that of a spectral 8-foot (2.4 meter) glowing-green brain with only two tentacles.

Alien and elusive, elven myths attest that Ilsensine surpassed its divine peers in subversive intent, always striving to undo what others accomplish and defy established convention; to this end, it allegedly set loose the mind flayers as a counter-creation after mortals came into existence. The name Ilsensine is only used by the sages and scholars of most races: illithids identify it using a series of telepathic visual images and symbolic denotations, and Ilsensine itself lacks a physical body.

Ilsensine only believes in power, which to him is represented by raw psionic force, superior knowledge, and the mental capacity and force of mind required to both wield it and dominate others: this naturally makes his illithid creations the supreme race in its eyes, most worthy to conquer all planes and eventually all of reality while using all other life forms as "cattle". Ilsensine's psionics are such that any non-mindless being approaching its true form can sense his energy, creating a "brain burn" that afflicted those entering its realm, and within his proximity psionic powers are nulled and no secrets can stay hidden from him. Despite his strengths, omnipresence and practically limitless (though distinctly not omniscient) knowledge, Ilsensine is not infallible: he is supremely arrogant and vulnerable to emotion, to the point that he can be overtaken by it and driven towards problematic behavior.

("You wouldn't want to change the future.")

In order to change the future and gain a full-scoring ascension, an Illithanachronounbinder must invoke [[The Illithid Staff]] with [[The Elder Cerebral Fluid]] affixed to it while standing atop the high altar to [[The Void (deity)|the Void]] on the Astral Plane, which takes the place of the usual lawful high altar. This grants them access to the Void as a branch, where they encounter all the [[Spirits (dNetHack)|spirits]] they previously bound and killed, with [[Numina]] serving as the final boss: the Illithanachronounbinder must defeat whatever spirits stand in their way and reach Ilsensine within the depths of the Void, then offer the Amulet on her altar there - this restores Ilsensine to her former glory and earns the character the title of Maanzecorian, and they will ascend having saved the Illithid Empire.

'''Ilsensine The Fallen''', {{white|7}}, appears as a [[monster]] that Illithanachronounbinders can encounter. She is a [[humanoid]] [[Lawful angels and minions|lawful angelic being]] that is [[strong]], will seek out and pick up items, can be seen via [[infravision]], and is considered [[Human (monster attribute)|human]].

Ilsensine the Fallen has a powerful [[passive]] [[magic missile]] attack similar to [[Oracle (monster)|the Oracle]], and possesses [[fire resistance]], [[sleep resistance]], [[poison resistance]], and [[stoning resistance]].

Ilsensine is always generated as peaceful, and will only appear on the final level of [[The Void (branch)|the Void]], where she is placed to the immediate left of her altar at level creation. She is not a valid form for [[polymorph]].

Of note is that there are currently no consequences for killing her outside of the usual penalties.
</simpletabs>

==Origin==
Ilsensine originates from ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', and debuts in the 2nd Edition as the the patron deity and creator of the illithids - this Ilsensine is referred to as "it" or "he", and his name means "great brain" or "powerful brain" in Undercommon. Also known as the Tentacled Lord and the God-Brain (not to be confused with a particular [[elder brain]]), Ilsensine embodied the illithids' ideals of mental prowess, unlimited knowledge and willful dominion over all other lifeforms; he was also the patron of all beings that enslaved the thoughts of others. Ilsensine's incarnation is a cohesive thought that takes the shape of a gigantic, pulsing mass of cerebral matter with a countless number of ganglionic tendrils radiating out in all directions; when incarnating in an avatar, his floating form is that of a spectral 8-foot (2.4 meter) glowing-green brain with only two tentacles.

Alien and elusive, elven myths attest that Ilsensine surpassed its divine peers in subversive intent, always striving to undo what others accomplish and defy established convention; to this end, it allegedly set loose the mind flayers as a counter-creation after mortals came into existence. The name Ilsensine is only used by the sages and scholars of most races: illithids identify it using a series of telepathic visual images and symbolic denotations, and Ilsensine itself lacks a physical body. 

Ilsensine only believes in power, which to him is represented by raw psionic force, superior knowledge, and the mental capacity and force of mind required to both wield it and dominate others: this naturally makes his illithid creations the supreme race in its eyes, most worthy to conquer all planes and eventually all of reality while using all other life forms as "cattle". Ilsensine's psionics are such that any non-mindless being approaching its true form can sense his energy, creating a "brain burn" that afflicted those entering its realm, and within his proximity psionic powers are nulled and no secrets can stay hidden from him. Despite his strengths, omnipresence and practically limitless (though distinctly ''not'' omniscient) knowledge, Ilsensine is not infallible: he is supremely arrogant and vulnerable to emotion, to the point that he can be overtaken by it and driven towards problematic behavior.
